Lecture 1.title: Introductions and Syllabus Review
Lecture 1.description: This is the introductory lecture for the course. It features introductions to the professor, TAs, and students, as well as information about the syllabus and the course content.

Lecture 2.title: Web Architectures
Lecture 2.description: This lecture is all about servers!

Lecture 3.title: Apache
Lecture 3.description: This lecture is about Apache, and deals specifically with the XAMPP stack package that we will be using in this course.

Lecture 4.title: HTML
Lecture 4.description: This lecture will discuss markup languages, specifically SGML, XML, HTML, and XHTML.

Lecture 5.title: CSS
Lecture 5.description: This lecture will discuss Cascading Stylesheets (CSS), which will be our main method of altering the visual display of our webpages.

Lecture 6.title: Advanced CSS
Lecture 6.description: This lecture is a more in-depth look at CSS, specifically about its limitations and best practices.

Lecture 7.title: Javascript
Lecture 7.description: This lecture goes in-depth on JavaScript, the high-level, client-side scripting language.

Lecture 8.title: AJAX & JSON
Lecture 8.description: This lecture focuses on JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) and Asynchronous Javascript and XML (AJAX).

Lecture 9.title: Git(Hub) Refresher
Lecture 9.description: This lecture will be all about Git. It will feature a discussions on 'vanilla' vs. GitHub, commands, and best practices, as well as the benefits and downsides of using git.

Lecture 10.title: Quiz 1 Review
Lecture 10.description: This slide deck will review the topics to be covered on Quiz 1.

Lecture 11.title: Front-end Optimization
Lecture 11.description: This lecture will discuss why performance is important, as well as how to measure and improve performance.

Lecture 12.title: Workflow
Lecture 12.description: This lecture will discuss the importance of smooth front-end workflow and user interface, user experience and performance.

Lecture 13.title: PHP
Lecture 13.description: This lecture will feature and introduction to PHP and will discuss the topics of PHP MySQL, authentication/authorization, session handling, web security, web services, back-end workflow.

Lecture 14.title: More PHP & Advanced PHP
Lecture 14.description: This lecture goes more in-depth on PHP, discussing its functions, interfaces, and abstract classes.

Lecture 15.title: Start MySQL, Advanced MySQL, More PHP & More MySQL
Lecture 15.description: This lecture discusses the MySQL Relational Database Management System and about how to create databases and tables, columns and fields, data types, and SQL syntax.

Lecture 16.title: PDO
Lecture 16.description: This lecture details selecting databases, user access, PHP Data Objects (PDOs), preparing statements, SQL injection attacks, and starting and ending sessions.

Lecture 17.title: Authentication
Lecture 17.description: This lecture deals with establishing permissions and verifying authenticity of requests, as well as solutions for better site and database security.

Lecture 18.title: Quiz 2 Review
Lecture 18.description: This slide deck will review the topics to be covered on Quiz 1.

Lab 4.title: Lab 4 - JavaScript and the Document Object Model

Lab 8.title: Lab 8 - PHP, OOP and Input Handling

Lab 10.title: Lab 10 - Final Boss (Web Science Systems Development)
